image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

props.synopsis: American medical giants want tariffs imposed on Australia as punishment for its Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme, which sees the government negotiate cheaper prices for medicines for Australians.

title.children: US pharmaceutical giants urge Trump to put further tariffs on Australia

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: The opposition leader put his team on notice. He vowed he would remember the name of anyone who freelanced on policies. A month on, there's one name on the list of offenders — Peter Dutton.

title.children: Dutton won't need help identifying MP breaking his pre-election edict

image.altText: A sign on the front of a building saying 'Genius Childcare', photographed through bars.

props.synopsis: Administrators have taken control of the majority of childcare centres run by teetering empire Genius.

title.children: Administrators take control over most of national childcare chain’s centres

image.altText: Two soldiers stand over a Congolese village in the hills.

props.synopsis: In the Democratic Republic of the Congo, battles are taking place for territory and rare earth minerals such as cobalt. Donald Trump is about to enter the race.

title.children: Is the Democratic Republic of the Congo next for Trump?

image.altText: A blonde woman faces a press pack

props.synopsis: Keli Lane, the woman convicted of killing her baby daughter in one of Australia's most notorious criminal cases, has been identified in NSW parliament as a victim of convicted sex offender and former prison officer Wayne Gregory Astill.

title.children: Convicted baby killer Keli Lane named as victim of former prison officer

image.altText: A picture of burnt out cars

props.synopsis: A Tesla service centre in Las Vegas has become the latest target in a series of attacks against the car maker, with the FBI blasting them as "unacceptable".

title.children: There's been an attack on Teslas. The FBI says it has 'hallmarks' of terrorism

image.altText: Trump rests his fingertips together at his desk in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin are both hailing their phone call as a significant step towards peace in Ukraine. That doesn't mean it was.

title.children: Trump needed a deal out of his call with Putin. He got almost nothing

image.altText: High up view of crowds and an open top car with a man in a suit and a woman in a pink outfit sitting in the back seat

props.synopsis: Conspiracy theories, new timelines and suspicions of KGB links were among the 80,000 pages of documents, many blurred and damaged by age.

title.children: New JFK files reveal assassin's trip to Soviet embassy before attack

image.altText: Mark Carney standing behind a podium delivering a speech in front of the Canadian flag

props.synopsis: For months, senior officials have been discussing exporting Australia's world-leading JORN radar technology to the United States, but after Donald Trump's return to the White House, Canada saw an opportunity and leapt.

title.children: Australia's 'biggest defence export' was meant for the US first, but Canada snuck past Trump

image.altText: A man in a suit puts his arm on a man in judge's robes

props.synopsis: US Chief Justice John Roberts rebukes President Donald Trump for calling for the impeachment of a federal judge, saying it is "not an appropriate response to disagreement concerning a judicial decision".

title.children: US chief justice pushes back on Trump's call to impeach federal judge

image.altText: A woman carries a boy on her shoulders as she walks past the rubble of destroyed buildings with other following.

props.synopsis: Aside from Israel's far-right politician Itamar Ben-Gvir and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, it is hard to see who benefits from the return to fighting that is leaving many wondering how much worse things can get.

title.children: Why has Netanyahu chosen to continue war rather than negotiate?

image.altText: Dutton smiles, sitting in parliament with his arms crossed

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's decision to float the idea of holding a national vote on criminal dual citizens has Liberal MPs privately questioning the Coalition's messaging and strategy.

title.children: Coalition MPs told to hose down Dutton's dual national referendum idea

image.altText: Suni Williams smiles and gives a thumbs up while lying in a stretcher wearing a white padded suit and helmet

props.synopsis: Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore are back on Earth after nine months in space. Now they're facing weeks of rehabilitation so they can resume their lives on the ground.

title.children: What does nine months in space do to the human body?

image.altText: murder victim Lilie James in a car wearing a yellow top smiles as she takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Lilie James was smiling and talking to her killer moments before her death with "no indication" of what he was going to do, an inquest has heard.

title.children: CCTV of Lilie James moments before her murder 'not easy to watch'

image.altText: A photo of a festival crowd in front of an outdoor stage during the daytime. There is confetti and lots of hands in the air.

props.synopsis: Good Life, a festival exclusively for teenagers that has previously been held in major cities across Australia, has announced it will not return this year.

title.children: Another Australian music festival announces 2025 pause due to rising costs

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission has found the man who led the Board of Inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann engaged in "serious corrupt conduct".

title.children: Head of inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann prosecution engaged in 'corrupt conduct'

image.altText: A Moree police officer playing goaltender at the PCYC hall

props.synopsis: NSW Police say dozens of young "ringleaders" committing violent crimes in the state's north and west will be the target of new rapid-response units.

title.children: 100 young 'ringleaders' targeted by police in youth crime crackdown

image.altText: A crowd fills a town hall for a protest meeting.

props.synopsis: One north-east Victorian town is battling a renewable energy project while its neighbour has plans to go totally green, fuelling policy division ahead of the election.

title.children: Victorian town pledges to take fight against battery storage to election

image.altText: A white brick wall outside a house with a graffitied swastika, then a word that is blurred, followed by the word Jews.

props.synopsis: A man who spray painted swastikas and anti-Semitic graffiti across several Perth suburbs is given a suspended jail sentence.

title.children: Man escapes jail for anti-Semitic graffiti across several Perth suburbs

image.altText: Shannon Cox with a football in his hand.

props.synopsis: Former Collingwood player Shannon Cox pleads guilty in a Perth court to manslaughter over the crash in WA's outback in which two women, aged in their 80s, both died.

title.children: Former AFL player Shannon Cox admits killing women in car crash

image.altText: Brandon Smith of the Sydney Roosters runs with the football during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Brandon Smith will join the South Sydney Rabbitohs and supercoach Wayne Bennett, with the Kiwi hooker signing a two-year deal from 2026.

title.children: Bennett gets his man as Smith locked in for Rabbitohs from 2026

image.altText: Detective Sargeant Chris Watson

props.synopsis: For the first time, the lead police investigator on the case is speaking about how they found those responsible for the death of Glenn Walewicz.

title.children: 'Shot dead by a complete stranger': How police cracked the case

image.altText: A close-up photo of a mother and daughter holding hands.

props.synopsis: Carly loved dressing as a girl from an early age and was preparing to start puberty blockers when the Queensland government banned her and hundreds of others from receiving free treatment. Her mother is furious at politicians for "interfering" in Carly's healthcare.

title.children: 'I don't want to grow a beard': Trans girl reacts to hormone ban

image.altText: Adam Bandt in Mural Hall

props.synopsis: As you would expect in the nation's current cheesed-off state of mind, all three major party leaders enjoyed sub-zero popularity among survey respondents. Everyone hates everything right now, especially if it's anywhere near politics. But it was surprising news for the Greens leader.

title.children: Sub-zero popularity aside, many voters don't even recognise this leader

image.altText: Dean Jupp looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: An accused murderer was "coming down" off drugs and "didn't want to be rude" when he agreed to help steal guns from a rural Tasmanian property, a court has heard.

title.children: Accused murderer 'didn't want to be rude' when he agreed to help steal guns in home invasion

image.altText: A group of people stand around a man in a suit speaking into a microphone at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Farmers pushed to the brink by drought have joined the state opposition on the steps of Adelaide's Parliament House calling for more government action.

title.children: SA farmers take 'gut-wrenchingly hard' drought battle to parliament

image.altText: A closeup of a woman's hands typing on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: Most working Australians now have the "right to disconnect" under the Fair Work Act, but experts warn "it's not all black and white".

title.children: ‘It's not black and white’: Navigating your right to disconnect from work

image.altText: Seb O Halloran

props.synopsis: The court was told the girl, who was 17 at the time, was acting in self-defence when she stabbed the Mildura man during an incident in 2023.

title.children: Tears of relief as teenage girl cleared of murder in Victoria

image.altText: A young woman embraces her medical equipment.

props.synopsis: Young South Australian woman Annaliese Holland is terminally ill, but she says being able to plan ahead has given her a sense of empowerment.

title.children: Annaliese likens her life to a 'field of landmines' — but planning has brought her peace

image.altText: A young man with brown hair stands in front of a white wall with some scaffolding attached, holding plans for a deck

props.synopsis: Construction workers are calling on the ACT government to speed up the approval process for development applications amid an ongoing housing crisis.

title.children: Waiting months for approval for a deck, tradies say change is needed

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses passes a piece of paper across a table to a grey-haired man.

props.synopsis: WA Premier Roger Cook's new cabinet is sworn in at Government House amid some confusion over where the buck stops in the health ministry.

title.children: Who’s the boss? Early confusion as WA’s new look cabinet is sworn in

image.altText: A solid gold toilet sculpture

props.synopsis: The 18-carat solid-gold toilet was on display for just two days at an English palace before it was stolen under the cover of darkness.

title.children: Two men found guilty over multi-million-dollar gold toilet heist
